name: La Morada Mas Hermosa Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely from the front door to the side breakfast area with the owner's beach art on the walls & many local guidebooks, thru the separating courtyard to halls full of art, to our room, number 4, for more fun art - we had a skylight with little painted doors above our bed, a spiral stair up to the bathroom with a tub to soak & a tiny patio up there to sit & look over the old roof tops in peace & quiet... Yet it so close to old town shopping or restaurants & a short walk to the beach promenande, a perfect location & you could not buy a breakfast this nice either for the price, complete with linens & pottery dishes from a small town in the mountains...just so many nice details all around & the owner, Paloma, along with her mother are the nicest, helpful B&B hostesses I think I've ever encountered...We stayed an extra day & would go again in an instant (to try another room) & will tell all to go there too!
reviews.title: Surprise Find Boutique Hotel

likes.liked: — All the little details--the hotel's webpage, art, bio-friendly products, owner & her mom, breakfast...
likes.disliked: — A bit difficult to park in the lot nearby & wheel your luggage over...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay in room 2. Very pleasant atmosphere, sitting at the balcony in the afternoon, in this quiet part of marbella overlooking the rooftops was very relaxing. The lady at the reception was very helpful and answered all our questions very patiently! We were sent a nice drawing with directions on how to find the hotel, but we had to turn three times around the block before we could find it! The third time we left our car nearby and decided to walk until we found the street: we realised we would never have found it if we insisted driving around in the car!!! It's a lovely tiny street, very charming just as the hotel.
reviews.title: Really charming hotel!!

reviews.text: I have travelled all over and stayed at some crazy hotels..good and bad..but this place was perfect...its set in the old city..out of the way..close to all the shops and many cafes...the rooms are great..with tv..not many channels howver..still a tv..big room..very charming...
reviews.title: perfect....

likes.disliked: — lack of premium movie channels at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great views from balcony..the morning breakfast is great..they bring it to you in a basket and starts your day right..
reviews.title: Wasn't going to tell you about this one

likes.disliked: — Nothing first time I have ever returned to a place twice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: free wifi and computer in the common room...i cant say enough about this place..
reviews.title: Charming and perfectly located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is a real gem!!! Located in a beautiful street in old Marbella, we had a great time!! It's very cozy, clean, provides great breakfast and is run by super nice people. Would go back anytime!!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: got back on the 23rd april the hotel is in great position in the old town quite at night but 2 mins from square,i found the hotel very clean and the breafast good which you can have in your room
reviews.title: great place
The most beautiful street in Marbella
reviews.text: i have nothing negative to say about this nice small bb and i will be going again soon

White, shiney walls, flowers on the balcony, the swifts flying by, the warm march sun on our backs. We have just returned from the most wonderful holiday in Spain at La Morada Mas Hermosa. As travellers used to something a little different, and away from the main drag, this hotel was perfect. We felt as though we had found the real spain. We stayed in the Suite Vera which was very reasonably priced and had lots of room - just like a little apartment with a lovely sunny balcony and sitting area too. The service was perfect, including delicious breakfasts delivered in baskets that we could take to our balcony, free internet access and my son was made to feel so special (with little chocolate treats left on his bed!) The built up bits of Marbella seem a long way away however the beaches are very close. We recommend Tapas Santiago for great food and a boat ride to Buerto Banus to see the yachts. Go to this hotel if you want to feel comfortable, relaxed and in the heart of a beautiful town. A real Spanish treat.
reviews.title: A Little Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As part of a party of 4 couples we stayed at the La Morada the weekend before Christmas. Instead of a large bland hotel we wanted something small, spanish and personal. Well this was just perfect. It's situated in the heart of the old town, with all the restaurants, small shops and cafe's to wander around and it's only a ten minute walk to the sea front. We were in room 2 which had the bedroom on one level and a spiral staircase which led to the bathroom and a small terrace. The terrace had potted plants, a lemon tree and table and chairs for two. We could have breakfast in the lounge, courtyard or in our room. We couldn't resist sitting in the warm winter sun having our breakfast on the terrace. All the rooms bar one are on two levels so if you have difficultly with stairs, request room no. 3. The management were friendly and helpful and they made us feel very welcome. I would love to return again.
reviews.title: Terrific!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The greatest hotel of our two week vacation in Spain. The hotel is located in the heart of a pedestrian area, with beautiful small passageways full of restaurants and cafes, and a walking distance to the beach. The room we stayed in was marvelously spacious and clean.
reviews.title: The greatest hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a beautiful setting in the old town in Marbella. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We stayed in Room 5 which is very spacious, lovely bathroom and great decor. The breakfast is delicious, this place is a haven we will be coming back.
reviews.title: perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at this hotel and wanted to write our review asap.
reviews.title: The perfect break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We telephoned the hotel and booked direct with them (the manager speaks excellent English) and arranged our flights separately.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — Room was dark and lacked ventilation in bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked the hotel to organise an airport pick-up and when we arrived at Malaga a lovely chap was waiting to drive us to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great small hotel in the heart of the Old Town

likes.liked: — The room was full of character
likes.disliked: — You did get a bit irritated if you'd left something upstairs . . . which meant walking back up the spiral staircase again! But that's just being lazy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 5 and had breakfast served in our room every morning (a lady delivers it in a wicker basket - the home-made cake is wonderful!). Our room was spotlessly clean and the owner was very helpful (particularly one night when she saw us going out for the evening without umbrellas...she told us it was going to rain - and it did - torrentially!).
reviews.title: Very nice small friendly hotel

likes.disliked: — Difficult to approach with the car

description: Our hotel’s special charm lies in its authenticity and simplicity. Located in the Old Town, where a traditional village atmosphere still pervades, the beach and shops are just a short stroll away. With our attentive service, every care is taken to make your stay both comfortable and relaxing.Our rooms are non-smoking and spotlessly clean. All are equipped with A/C hot/cold, ceiling fan, telephone,hairdryer, 20” flat screen TV and satellite TV channels, free WiFi access and a safe. Bed linen is 100% cotton and bathrooms are stocked with natural & organic toiletries. Breakfast service available included in room rate.
